attributes.action: provide properly maintained and resourced public toilets in all towns,cities and public spaces for people with Irritable Bowel Syndrome
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Without easy access to public toilets, people with irritable bowel syndrome find it difficult to travel, to shop or simply to have the same quality of social life as their friends and colleagues. 

Properly maintained and resourced public toilets form a vital amenity in towns and cities. The Gut Trust believes that local councils have a duty to provide them for the good of their residents, and that companies and shops have a vested interest in supporting public toilets in their area.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "provide properly maintained and resourced public toilets in all towns,cities and public spaces for people with Irritable Bowel Syndrome."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page21174
